Review: David Ayer has managed to scratch a 90’s era Tony Scott itch that I’ve been missing for quite some time. It’s not quite The Last Boy Scout—there’s no Shane Black, and it’s definitely not True Romance—there’s no Tarantino, but it’s totally (tonally?) got shades of 90’s era Tony Scott, and that’s something that I can bee grateful for.

“There's a point at 7,000 RPM where everything fades. The machine becomes weightless. Just disappears. And all that's left is a body moving through space and time.”One of the best racing films ever made. The film gets at the heart & soul of racing and automotive passion, and does so by telling a story of two men taking on the automotive establishment that simply don’t understand that world. An Outsiders vs. Insiders story done well with solid lead performances from…
Bleh. Almost shut this one off half way in, but I survived. It really is bizarre that a Netflix movie is making the case for physical media.
For real, those car crashes really got into my head on the drive home. Probably Michael Mann’s best since Collateral. Anyway, Penélope Cruz kinda drives away with the picture. Good show.

“I have enough friends!”**Kicks dude into airplane engine**Die Hard 2: Die Harder is the only sequel in the series that feels like a legit extension of the original film. The humor, the supporting characters, the utilization of a memorable central location (a bustling international airport) and Christmas setting (this time with loads of snow) all ring familiar. Sadly it is missing John McTiernan’s directorial graces and Jan DeBont’s cinematography, and it doesn’t have as memorable a main villain…
“We're cool, we're badasses, blah, blah, blah...”

“Tell her that she’s the best thing that ever happened to a bum like me. She’s heard me say ‘I Love You’ a thousand times. She never heard me say ‘I’m Sorry’. I want you to tell her that, Al. Tell her that John said that he was sorry.”
I cried through a Godzilla movie… for the right reasons.
“We all breathe liquid for nine months, Bud. Your body will remember.”
“I find the world a bitter and complicated place. And it seems to feel the same way about me. You and I have that in common, I think.”
“If you can't say something nice, don't say nothing at all.”
Nobody knows quite how to capture scope, across the frame; corner-to-corner, the way that Ridley Scott does. This is his Barry Lyndon, and I am absolutely itching for that 4-hour Director’s Cut.
